content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Accessibility Tree with numerical label representing information about the page, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
4) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {Accessibility Tree of a web page}
Now given a task: Find all Uniqlo locations in Chicago, IL.  Please interact with https://www.google.com/maps/ and get the answer.Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to search in Google Maps. Use the search box combobox element [2] and input query "Uniqlo Chicago IL".
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need list of all Uniqlo locations in Chicago. Re‚Äërun search to display results list, not just this single place.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to perform a fresh search that shows all Uniqlo locations; type new query again into search box [2] and execute.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo locations Chicago
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Search term too specific; maps suggests spelling or specifying city. Try a simpler query: "Uniqlo Chicago" in the search box [2] to get list of locations.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Try a query that encourages listing results, e.g., ‚ÄúUniqlo near Chicago IL‚Äù, to display all stores rather than opening one.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo near Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to activate the search box to enter a new query that will list all Uniqlo stores. First click the combobox.
Action: Click [2]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Replace the current text in the focused search box with a broader query so Maps lists all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Close the current place details panel, returning to regular search view so we can run a new query listing all Uniqlo stores.
Action: Click [1038]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter a query that will list all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.  
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use the Nearby search option in the side‚Äëpanel to list other Uniqlo stores around Chicago rather than re‚Äëopening the same place.
Action: Click [6071]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter ‚ÄúUniqlo‚Äù into the active ‚ÄúSearch nearby‚Äù box so Maps lists all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Replace text in search box with ‚ÄúUniqlo Chicago IL‚Äù to list all stores in the city.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to activate the search box so a new query can be entered to list all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Click [2]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search box is focused and showing suggestions. Enter a new query that lists every Uniqlo in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to replace the current text in the search field with a city‚Äëwide query so Maps shows all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search box needs to be focused before entering a new city‚Äëwide query.  
Action: Click [2]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The search box is active; replace current text with ‚ÄúUniqlo Chicago IL‚Äù to list all Chicago stores.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter the city‚Äëwide query again so it appears in the box, then we can click the Search button next iteration.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Clear the current query to allow typing a new search for all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Click [7882]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Need to perform a new search listing all Uniqlo stores in Chicago. Enter the query into the focused search box.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Close the current place details panel so we can conduct a new search for another Uniqlo location in Chicago.
Action: Click [9503]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter a city‚Äëwide query in the search box to retrieve all Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo Chicago IL
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Perform a fresh search that lists every ‚ÄúUniqlo‚Äù near the current Chicago map view instead of opening one store‚Äôs page.  
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Use the ‚ÄúNearby‚Äù feature to list other UNIQLO stores around Chicago; first open the Nearby search interface.
Action: Click [11577]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Enter ‚ÄúUniqlo‚Äù into the ‚ÄúSearch nearby‚Äù field so Maps lists nearby Uniqlo stores in Chicago.
Action: Type [2]; Uniqlo
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Focus the search box so I can replace the current text with a broader query listing all Uniqlo stores.
Action: Click [2]
Observation: An accessibility tree. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Choose the suggestion ‚ÄúUNIQLO near North State Street, Chicago, IL‚Äù so Maps lists nearby Uniqlo stores instead of this single location.
Action: Click [13692]
